header.description: Entrepreneurs of the Amazon: Building Sustainable and Creative Technologies for the Women's Movement in the Islands of Belém do Pará - Brazil (MMIB)

mmibDescription.mmib: promotes ecotourism on Cotijuba Island and implements projects that benefit the entire community, from the youth to the elderly, while fostering collaboration, female empowerment, and bioentrepreneurship.

compamostraDescription.description5: as a prominent event in the entrepreneurial culture on the North of Brazil.

cesupaSthem.description3: in teacher training for active methodologies, promoting the strengthening of game-based learning through the creation of Hackathons, innovation marathons, and Project Based Learning (PBL).

about.objective1: Promote technological and entrepreneurial solutions in the Amazon.
about.objective2: Strengthening the innovation ecosystem and networking.
about.objective3: Interrelationship between students and technology companies in the market.
about.objective4: Creating immersive experiences in islands and communities for students.

program.title: The Program
program.description3: is an educational program for students of Computer Science and Computer Engineering courses at CESUPA. It aims to connect companies committed to Amazonian sustainability, the local community with its traditional knowledge, and scientific and technological knowledge for the bioeconomic development of the region.

header.description: After experiencing an immersive visit, the university students developed sustainable projects for Cotijuba Island and its community, in partnership with MMIB, a nonprofit institution dedicated to promoting autonomy and citizen knowledge.

gallery.subheading-bcc: Choose the top Computer Science project!
gallery.subheading-ecomp: Choose the top Computer Engineering project!

alertMessages.error: Error registering vote, try again later.

firstPlace.title: Zenith Inova
firstPlace.description: Zenith has developed the Falken Module, consisting of a frequency reader combined with a unidirectional antenna, capable of measuring the power of 2G, 3G, and 4G network signals. Together, these devices form a measurement module for remotely piloted aircraft, or RPAS.

secondPlace.title: CVGreen
secondPlace.description: A mobile application for tree trunk recognition through artificial intelligence.

thirdPlace.title: Helix
thirdPlace.description: Hélix introduces the L.C.H.M.S. (Low-Cost Hydraulic Monitoring System), a modular system designed to facilitate the large-scale implementation of equipment capable of collecting water quality parameters. The project was developed to be highly modular, allowing for easy replacement of installed sensors to meet the specific needs of each client. Additionally, the prototype meets the requirements to be part of the RNQA. (Rede Nacional de Monitoramento) proposed by the National Water Agency, which aims to deploy equipment capable of providing information about the quality of water resources across the entire national territory.

firstPlace.title: BioTank
firstPlace.description: BioTank is a project that aims to provide a clean and sustainable source of cooking gas for the residents of Ilha das Onças Island

secondPlace.title: IWCFSS
secondPlace.description: The first instance of a water treatment project for irrigation, which involved the creation of an intelligent water capture, filtration, and storage system (IWCFSS).

thirdPlace.title: AutoDrops
thirdPlace.description: An automated irrigation system for those who don't have time to take care of their plants on their balcony or for those who make a living from production.

2022.description: A frequency reader that measures the strength of 2G, 3G and 4G network signals.

2023.description: Terrestrial drone to increase and automate priprioca planting.

2023.name: EcoRota
2023.description: Ecorota is a digital community ecotourism agency on the islands of Belém.
Terrestrial drone for automated priprioca planting

Ecorota is a digital community ecotourism agency on the islands of Belém, where tourists will use services from the islands themselves, thus learning more about the culture, community and environmental problems, thereby contributing to the local economy and environmental education in the region.
